qas.question: The Xbox 360 Pro included what size hard drive storage?
What was the official name of the lower-priced 360 SKU at launch?
The Xbox 360 Elite eventually launched at what price point?
The 360 Pro's original storage was replaced by a hard drive of what size in 2008?
What did Microsoft name the SKU that replaced the 360 Core?
What was the Xbox 360 Core package unofficially known as?
What was the Media Remote priced at in USD?
How much was the Xbox 360 Arcade?
When was the Core package launched?

context: At launch, the Xbox 360 was available in two configurations: the "Xbox 360" package (unofficially known as the <a0_0><b5_0>20 GB<a0_0/> Pro or Premium<b5_0/>), priced at US$399 or GB£279.99, and the "<a1_0>Xbox 360 Core<a1_0/>", priced at <b7_0>US$299<b7_0/> and GB£209.99. The original shipment of the Xbox 360 version included a cut-down version of the Media Remote as a promotion. The Elite package was launched later at <a2_0><b6_0>US$479<a2_0/>.<b6_0/> The "<b9_0>Xbox 360 Core<b9_0/>" was replaced by the "<a4_0>Xbox 360 Arcade<a4_0/>" in <b8_0>October 2007<b8_0/> and a <a3_0>60 GB<a3_0/> version of the Xbox 360 Pro was released on August 1, 2008. The Pro package was discontinued and marked down to US$249 on August 28, 2009 to be sold until stock ran out, while the Elite was also marked down in price to US$299.
